channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Biden committed ‘impeachable conduct,’ ‘defrauded United States to enrich his family’: House GOP report
item.description: President Biden engaged in “impeachable conduct," “abused his office" and “defrauded the United States to enrich his family," House Republicans allege in highly anticipated report.

item.title: House finds Biden used office to enrich family, conceal evidence
item.description: President Biden committed impeachable offenses by helping his family bank millions of dollars from lucrative foreign and domestic business deals and then conspired to hide the evidence and obstruct an investigation by Congress, House lawmakers concluded in a new report.

item.title: A Salzburg Sampler
item.description: On a quartet of performances at this summer’s Salzburg Festival.

item.title: Trump Is Right: Kamala Harris And Tim Walz Are The Ultimate DEI Ticket
item.description: Neither Trump nor his allies should be afraid to attack the moral bankruptcy of DEI that has fueled the policy disasters of Harris and Walz.

item.title: Catholic Charities asks Supreme Court to protect First Amendment rights in battle against the state
item.description: A Catholic Charities group in Wisconsin is appealing to the U.S. Supreme Court in its fight to stay exempt from the state's unemployment program.

item.title: Start of Democratic National Convention draws headlines
item.description: Brace yourselves. It's time for the Democratic Party to command the national stage via the four-day 2024 Democratic National Convention in Chicago, starting Monday. The days begin at 7 a.m. Central Time with "delegation breakfast" and wind down at 10 p.m. with a final gavel.

item.title: Kamala Harris Proposes Bidenomics, but Bigger
item.description: For progressives who somehow thought Biden was too moderate, a President Harris would kick things up a notch — no matter the consequences.

item.title: Kamala Harris Wants To Impose A Soviet-Style Medical System On Americans
item.description: The Medicare for All world Harris wants for America would mean no care providers, no money for care, death-by-queue, and national bankruptcy.

item.title: DNC kicks off in Chicago to nominate Harris-Walz as anti-Israel protesters prepare counter-rally
item.description: The Democratic National Convention begins Monday, as top Democrats travel to Chicago to celebrate the nomination of Vice President Kamala Harris as the party’s presidential nominee.

item.title: Convention delegates will nominate Harris, again. This time, there's less suspense and more pizzazz
item.description: Once more, with feeling!

item.title: Passing Educational-Freedom Legislation Is Only the First Step
item.description: School-choice advocates face challenges beyond just implementation, even in friendly states.

item.title: Taking Sides In The Jewish-Arab Conflict Is Wreaking Havoc On Ivy League Universities
item.description: The reckoning continues for Ivy League presidents who allowed pro-Palestinian protesters to terrorize their campuses.

item.title: Flashback: Obama was one of earliest big-name Dems to endorse Walz at dawn of his political career
item.description: Former President Obama was one of the few high-profile Democrats to campaign for Tim Walz during his first congressional run in 2006, the Minnesota governor said in 2017.

item.title: From 'that little girl' to Democrats' savior: Kamala Harris' dizzying rise to the top
item.description: In less than a month, Kamala Harris has gone from the most unpopular vice president in modern U.S. history to an adored Democratic presidential nominee who reversed the party's fortunes, opening leads in some battleground states and putting former President Donald Trump on defense.

item.title: State Taxes: Good Cuts, Bad Cuts
item.description: Annual legislative sessions have wrapped up, and taxpayers have once again gained ground.

item.title: If Republicans Want To Extend Trump’s Tax Cuts, They Should Cut Spending To Do It
item.description: The supply-side approach can yield economic growth — but it gives politicians an excuse not to reduce disastrous government spending.

item.title: Dems project images on Trump Tower ahead of DNC
item.description: The Democratic National Committee will project images directly onto Trump International Hotel and Tower in Chicago on Sunday as the party gets ready to start its convention.

item.title: IRS employees increasingly snooping on taxpayers, but DOJ rarely prosecutes
item.description: IRS employees are increasingly poking into taxpayers' secret information -- a violation of the law -- but prosecutors are refusing to go after them, the agency's inspector general said in a new report.

item.title: Forget Politics. Try Gratitude Instead
item.description: An alternative to the current madness.

item.title: EXCLUSIVE: Feds Are Helping Register Alabama Prisoners To Vote
item.description: Feds 'deployed' a 'liberal' org to help register Alabaman federal prisoners to vote, according to a statement from the secretary of state.
